TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ThingBase extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.HealthVault.Thing.IThing

Docs.summary: Represents a thing.
Docs.remarks:
A thing is a single piece of data in a health record that is accessible through the HealthVault service. Examples of health record items include a blood pressure measurement, an exercise session, or an insurance claim.
things are typed and have XML data that adheres to the schema for the type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 GetSizeInBytes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the size of the thing which will be added to the quota used in the person's health record.
Docs.returns: The size in bytes of the thing.
Docs.remarks: This size may be used to determine if there is sufficient room left in the person's health record. It is recommended that this be used only for large items that may cause the person to exceed their quota. This measurement is an approximation. The HealthVault service may evaluate the item to have slightly more or fewer bytes depending on how the white space is transformed between the client and server. The person's health record quota usage may also change on the HealthVault service due to data being added by other applications.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsDownVersioned As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets the value indicating if the is down-versioned.
Docs.remarks: If this value is true then an attempt to update the will fail.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsImmutable As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is immutable.
Docs.value: true if the is immutable; otherwise, false.
Docs.remarks:
This data value is only available when the show the
bit set. Returns true if either ThingBase Type is immutable or ThingBase instance is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.IsPersonal : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the is private.
Docs.remarks: Private items are accessible only by custodians. show the bit set.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.IsReadOnly : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether is read-only.
Docs.value: true if the is read-only; otherwise, false.
Docs.remarks: Returns true if either ThingBase Type is immutable or ThingBase instance is read-only but sets only the instance immutability.
Docs.exception: Cannot change read-only flag to false if it is already true.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsUpVersioned As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets the value indicating if the is up-versioned.
Docs.remarks: If this value is true then an application should get explicit permission to update the instance from the user. This will cause the stored instance to be converted to the type version which may cause data loss in some cases.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Key : Microsoft.HealthVault.Thing.ThingKey with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets the key of the thing.
Docs.value: A globally unique identifier for the item issued when the item is created and a globally unique version stamp updated every time the item is changed.
Docs.remarks: This is the only property that is guaranteed to be available regardless of how is set.

Docs.remarks:

This data value is only available when the show the bit set.

Docs.remarks:
Derived classes should override this method and populate their members with the data from the XML.
The default implementation does nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string Serialize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the XML representation of the item for serialization.
Docs.returns: A string containing the XML representation of the item.
Docs.remarks:
There are two ways to obtain an XML representation of the item. GetItemXml() returns only the XML for the type-specific information of the item. Serialize() returns the full XML.
Use GetItemXml() if you want to save the XML representation to pass to the HealthVault platform for a new or update operation. Use Serialize if you want to serialize and deserialize the item and have the deserialized item be identical to the serialized one.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TransformedXmlData As IDictionary(Of String, XDocument)

Docs.summary: Gets the transformed XML data of the .
Docs.remarks:
Transformed XML data is provided if you so specify in . The dictionary values are indexed by the name of the transform that was specified when the search was performed.
This data value is only available to get when the show the bit set though it will not contain data unless a transform was specified when getting the item.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TypeSpecificData : System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML representation of the type-specific data for the .
Docs.remarks:
This data might contain data from other applications that also work with the same type of data. Take care not to overwrite existing data when making updates. Do not remove or manipulate elements in the XML that you do not understand.
If this property is set on a type derived from the data is not parsed into the object model so properties of the class may still show old data.
This data value is only available to get when the show the bit set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteXml(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub WriteXml (writer As XmlWriter)
abstract member WriteXml : System.Xml.XmlWriter -> unit override this.WriteXml : System.Xml.XmlWriter -> unit

Docs.param: The XmlWriter that receives the type-specific data.
Docs.summary: Writes the XML for the type-specific data of the item to the specified XmlWriter.
Docs.remarks:
Derived classes should override this method and write the type- specific XML which goes in the data-xml section of the item.
The default implementation writes the XML in the property to the specified writer.
